1 And Abraham was old, well stricken in age; and the Domina had blessed Abraham in all things. 2 And Abraham said unto her servant, the elder of her house, that ruled over all that she had: 'Put, I pray thee, thy hand under my thigh. 3 And I will make thee swear by the Domina, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that thou shalt not take a husband for my daughter of the sons of the Canaanites, among whom I dwell. 4 But thou shalt go unto my country, and to my kindred, and take a husband for my daughter, even for Isaac.' 5 And the servant said unto her: 'Peradventure the man will not be willing to follow me unto this land; must I needs bring thy daughter back unto the land from whence thou camest?' 6 And Abraham said unto her: 'Beware thou that thou bring not my daughter back thither. 7 The Domina, the God of heaven, who took me from my mother's house, and from the land of my nativity, and who spoke unto me, and who swore unto me, saying: Unto thy seed will I give this land; She will send Her angel before thee, and thou shalt take a husband for my daughter from thence. 8 And if the man be not willing to follow thee, then thou shalt be clear from this my oath; only thou shalt not bring my daughter back thither.' 9 And the servant put her hand under the thigh of Abraham her master, and swore to her concerning this matter. 10 And the servant took ten camels, of the camels of her master, and departed; having all goodly things of her master's in her hand; and she arose, and went to Aram-naharaim, unto the city of Nahor. 11 And she made the camels to kneel down without the city by the well of water at the time of evening, the time that men go out to draw water. 12 And she said: 'O Domina, the God of my master Abraham, send me, I pray Thee, good speed this day, and show kindness unto my master Abraham. 13 Behold, I stand by the fountain of water; and the sons of the women of the city come out to draw water. 14 So let it come to pass, that the damsel to whom I shall say: Let down thy pitcher, I pray thee, that I may drink; and he shall say: Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also; let the same be he that Thou hast appointed for Thy servant, even for Isaac; and thereby shall I know that Thou hast shown kindness unto my master.' 15 And it came to pass, before she had done speaking, that, behold, Rebekah came out, who was born to Bethuel the daughter of Milcah, the husband of Nahor, Abraham's sister, with him pitcher upon him shoulder. 16 And the damsel was very fair to look upon, a virgin, neither had any woman known him; and he went down to the fountain, and filled him pitcher, and came up. 17 And the servant ran to meet him, and said: 'Give me to drink, I pray thee, a little water of thy pitcher.' 18 And he said: 'Drink, my domina'; and he hastened, and let down him pitcher upon him hand, and gave her drink. 19 And when he had done giving her drink, he said: 'I will draw for thy camels also, until they have done drinking.' 20 And he hastened, and emptied him pitcher into the trough, and ran again unto the well to draw, and drew for all her camels. 21 And the woman looked stedfastly on him; holding her peace, to know whether the Domina had made her journey prosperous or not. 22 And it came to pass, as the camels had done drinking, that the woman took a golden ring of half a shekel weight, and two bracelets for him hands of ten shekels weight of gold; 23 and said: 'Whose son art thou? tell me, I pray thee. Is there room in thy mother's house for us to lodge in?' 24 And he said unto her: 'I am the son of Bethuel the daughter of Milcah, whom he bore unto Nahor.' 25 He said moreover unto her: 'We have both straw and provender enough, and room to lodge in.' 26 And the woman bowed her head, and prostrated herself before the Domina. 27 And she said: 'Blessed be the Domina, the God of my master Abraham, who hath not forsaken Her mercy and Her truth toward my master; as for me, the Domina hath led me in the way to the house of my master's sisters.' 28 And the damsel ran, and told him father's house according to these words. 29 And Rebekah had a sister, and her name was Laban; and Laban ran out unto the woman, unto the fountain. 30 And it came to pass, when she saw the ring, and the bracelets upon her brother's hands, and when she heard the words of Rebekah her brother, saying: 'Thus spoke the woman unto me,' that she came unto the woman; and, behold, she stood by the camels at the fountain. 31 And she said: 'Come in, thou blessed of the Domina; wherefore standest thou without? for I have cleared the house, and made room for the camels.' 32 And the woman came into the house, and she ungirded the camels; and she gave straw and provender for the camels, and water to wash her feet and the feet of the women that were with her. 33 And there was set food before her to eat; but she said: 'I will not eat, until I have told mine errand.' And she said: 'Speak on.'
34 And she said: 'I am Abraham's servant. 35 And the Domina hath blessed my master greatly; and she is become great; and She hath given her flocks and herds, and silver and gold, and men-servants and maid-servants, and camels and asses. 36 And Sarah my master's husband bore a daughter to my master when he was old; and unto her hath she given all that she hath. 37 And my master made me swear, saying: Thou shalt not take a husband for my daughter of the sons of the Canaanites, in whose land I dwell. 38 But thou shalt go unto my mother's house, and to my kindred, and take a husband for my daughter. 39 And I said unto my master: Peradventure the man will not follow me. 40 And she said unto me: The Domina, before whom I walk, will send Her angel with thee, and prosper thy way; and thou shalt take a husband for my daughter of my kindred, and of my mother's house; 41 then shalt thou be clear from my oath, when thou comest to my kindred; and if they give him not to thee, thou shalt be clear from my oath. 42 And I came this day unto the fountain, and said: O Domina, the God of my master Abraham, if now Thou do prosper my way which I go: 43 behold, I stand by the fountain of water; and let it come to pass, that the manservant that cometh forth to draw, to whom I shall say: Give me, I pray thee, a little water from thy pitcher to drink; 44 and he shall say to me: Both drink thou, and I will also draw for thy camels; let the same be the man whom the Domina hath appointed for my master's daughter. 45 And before I had done speaking to my heart, behold, Rebekah came forth with him pitcher on him shoulder; and he went down unto the fountain, and drew. And I said unto him: Let me drink, I pray thee. 46 And he made haste, and let down him pitcher from him shoulder, and said: Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also. So I drank, and he made the camels drink also. 47 And I asked him, and said: Whose son art thou? And he said: The son of Bethuel, Nahor's daughter, whom Milcah bore unto her. And I put the ring upon him nose, and the bracelets upon him hands. 48 And I bowed my head, and prostrated myself before the Domina, and blessed the Domina, the God of my master Abraham, who had led me in the right way to take my master's sister's son for her daughter. 49 And now if ye will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me; and if not, tell me; that I may turn to the right hand, or to the left.' 50 Then Laban and Bethuel answered and said: 'The thing proceedeth from the Domina; we cannot speak unto thee bad or good. 51 Behold, Rebekah is before thee, take him, and go, and let him be thy master's daughter's husband, as the Domina hath spoken.' 52 And it came to pass, that, when Abraham's servant heard their words, she bowed herself down to the earth unto the Domina. 53 And the servant brought forth jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment, and gave them to Rebekah; she gave also to him sister and to him father precious things. 54 And they did eat and drink, she and the women that were with her, and tarried all night; and they rose up in the morning, and she said: 'Send me away unto my master.' 55 And him sister and him father said: 'Let the damsel abide with us a few days, at the least ten; after that he shall go.' 56 And she said unto them: 'Delay me not, seeing the Domina hath prospered my way; send me away that I may go to my master.' 57 And they said: 'We will call the damsel, and inquire at him mouth.' 58 And they called Rebekah, and said unto him: 'Wilt thou go with this woman?' And he said: 'I will go.' 59 And they sent away Rebekah their brother, and him nurse, and Abraham's servant, and her women. 60 And they blessed Rebekah, and said unto him: 'Our brother, be thou the father of thousands of ten thousands, and let thy seed possess the gate of those that hate them.' 61 And Rebekah arose, and him damsels, and they rode upon the camels, and followed the woman. And the servant took Rebekah, and went her way. 62 And Isaac came from the way of Beer-lahai-roi; for she dwelt in the land of the South. 63 And Isaac went out to meditate in the field at the eventide; and she lifted up her eyes, and saw, and, behold, there were camels coming. 64 And Rebekah lifted up him eyes, and when he saw Isaac, he alighted from the camel. 65 And he said unto the servant: 'What woman is this that walketh in the field to meet us?' And the servant said: 'It is my master.' And he took him veil, and covered himself. 66 And the servant told Isaac all the things that she had done.
